profileAlternative.name: Raymond Gallardo
profileAlternative.headline: User Assistance Developer for Java SE at Oracle

positions.title: Oracle
positions.description:
• Documentation Release Lead for Java SE 8, 9, 10, 11, and 12. In this role, developed documentation plans and assigned tasks to other writers.
• Created content for Java SE 7, 8, 9, 10, 11, and 12 for these guides: The Java Tutorials, Nashorn, Java Scripting, Internationalization, Java Usage Tracker, Garbage Collection, Internationalization, Accessibility, What's New, Tools, Core Libraries, and Java Security. Highlights include:
- Managed the publication of The Java Tutorials (6th ed., Addison Wesley), including copy editing
- Created document on invokedynamic instruction, which simplifies implementations of compilers for dynamic languages on JVM; was published in Java Magazine (Premiere Issue 2011) as "Dynamically Typed Languages and the invokedynamic Instruction."
- Created sample application for JDBC tutorial that supports MySQL and Java DB and includes Swing-based GUI.
- Created section on how to work with bidirectional text in GUI applications.
- Created sections on lambda expressions and method parameter reflection
• Developed a certification preparation video for Java Programming II and wrote and reviewed questions for certification exams.
• Helped plan migration of authoring format from FrameMaker to Arbortext/DITA/SDL and create Java documentation guidelines for DITA.
• Responded to customer feedback and promptly fixed issues reported by customers.
• Posted several blogs related to documentation during JavaOne and every Java SE release.
• Coordinated a major nroff man page review for the tools pages.
• Maintained build scripts that generate the developer's guide.
• Updated and maintained scripts (written in Perl, C shell, and XSLT) that build documentation; updates include adding XML validation and documentation accessibility tests.
• Presented web conferences to other Java writers. Previous topics include performing competitive reviews and virtual teams.

• Ported internal text-replacement tool from Windows to AIX.
• Wrote several Perl scripts facilitating management of HTML documents, including script that generates table of contents for Dinkumware's Standard Template Library documentation.
• Mentored co-op students. Familiarized them with information development processes and tools, and delegated to them assignments and projects.
• Coordinated standardized process of generating PDF documents from HTML files.
• Designed tutorial for WebSphere Business Components (WSBC). Tutorial included instructions for building Rose models, and basic concepts of Enterprise JavaBeans and JSP/Servlets development.
